classes.name: CircuitConnectionRouter
classes.description:
Orthogonal router for circuit/schematic diagrams.

  • Bridge (arc): drawn at crossings where connections have NO shared ports
  • Vertex (dot): drawn at crossings where connections share a source or target port

Use {@link draw2d.layout.connection.ManhattanBridgedConnectionRouter} if you only need bridges.

functions.name: init
functions.description: Creates a new Router object.

parameters.name: attr
parameters.description: optional attributes for the router

parameters.name: attr.bridgeRadius
parameters.description: the radius of the bridge arc in pixels

parameters.name: attr.vertexRadius
parameters.description: the radius of the vertex circle (default: connection stroke * 2)

parameters.name: setter
parameters.description: optional key/value map of injected setter-methods

parameters.name: getter
parameters.description: optional key/value map of injected getter-methods

functions.name: onInstall
functions.description: Callback method if the router has been assigned to a connection.

parameters.name: connection
parameters.description: The assigned connection

functions.name: onUninstall
functions.description: Callback method if the router has been removed from the connection. In the case of the CircuitRouter all vertex nodes will be removed from the canvas.

parameters.name: connection
parameters.description: The related connection

functions.name: setVertexRadius
functions.description: Set the radius of the vertex circle. If not set, defaults to connection stroke * 2.

functions.name: getVertexRadius
functions.description: Get the vertex radius.

functions.name: _getVertexRadius
functions.description: Get the vertex radius for drawing. Returns the set value or calculates default from connection stroke.

functions.name: setJunctionRadius
functions.description: deprecated

functions.name: setBridgeRadius
functions.description: Set the radius or span of the bridge. A bridge will be drawn if two connections are crossing and didn't have any common port.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: the radius of the arc in pixels

functions.name: getBridgeRadius
functions.description: Get the bridge radius.

functions.name: route
functions.description: Routes the Connection.

parameters.name: connection
parameters.description: The Connection to route

parameters.name: routingHints
parameters.description: some helper attributes for the router

parameters.name: routingHints.startMoved
parameters.description: is true if just the start location has moved

parameters.name: routingHints.endMoved
parameters.description: is true if the destination location has changed

parameters.name: routingHints.oldVertices
parameters.description: the vertices before the reroute has been triggered

functions.name: _normalizeVertices
functions.description:
Normalize vertices to ensure perfect orthogonal lines. This corrects floating point errors from division operations. Only internal vertices are modified - start and end points remain unchanged to preserve port attachment.

Manhattan routes always alternate between horizontal and vertical segments. We determine the first segment direction from start point and align accordingly.

functions.name: _route
functions.description: Internal routing algorithm.

functions.name: attr
functions.description:
Read or set router attributes.
When no value is given, reads specified attribute from the element.
When value is given, sets the attribute to that value. Multiple attributes can be set by passing an object with name-value pairs.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: attribute name or object with name-value pairs

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: value to set (only if name is a string)

returns.description: either the requested attribute if this method used as getter or this if the method used as setter

functions.name: canRemoveVertexAt
functions.description: Callback method for the PolyLine or Connection to check if it possible to remove a vertex from the list. The router can send an veto for this. Per default it is not possible to remove any vertex from the PolyLine exceptional if any interactive router is installed.

functions.name: canRemoveSegmentAt
functions.description: Callback method for the PolyLine or Connection to verify that a segment is deletable.

functions.name: getPersistentAttributes
functions.description: Tweak or enrich the polyline persistence data with routing information

parameters.name: memento
parameters.description: The memento data of the polyline

functions.name: setPersistentAttributes
functions.description: set the attributes for the polyline with routing information

parameters.name: memento
parameters.description: the JSON data to read

functions.name: onDrag
functions.description: The draw2d.Connection delegates the drag operation to the router. The router can handle the different constraints of the connection.

parameters.name: dx
parameters.description: the x difference between the start of the drag drop operation and now

parameters.name: dy
parameters.description: the y difference between the start of the drag drop operation and now

parameters.name: dx2
parameters.description: The x diff since the last call of this dragging operation

parameters.name: dy2
parameters.description: The y diff since the last call of this dragging operation

functions.name: verticesSet
functions.description: Called by the connection if the vertices set outside. This enforce the router to avoid full autoroute. E.g. InteractiveManhattanRouter

functions.name: clone
functions.description: Return a clone of the router object

constructor.name: CircuitConnectionRouter

classes.name: FanConnectionRouter
classes.description: Automatic router that spreads its {@link draw2d.Connection Connections} in a fan-like fashion upon collision.

functions.description: Callback method if the router has been assigned to a connection.

parameters.name: connection
parameters.description: The assigned connection

functions.name: route
functions.description: Layout the hands over connection in a manhattan like layout

parameters.name: oldVertices
parameters.description: old/existing vertices of the Connection

parameters.description: some helper attributes for the router

parameters.name: routingHints.startMoved
parameters.description: is true if just the start location has moved

parameters.name: routingHints.destMoved
parameters.description: is true if the destination location has changed

functions.name: routeCollision
functions.description: route the connection if connections overlap. Two connections overlap if the combination of source and target anchors are equal.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Total number of overlapping connections

classes.name: InteractiveCircuitConnectionRouter
classes.description:
Combines the interactive segment manipulation of {@link draw2d.layout.connection.InteractiveManhattanConnectionRouter} with the circuit diagram features of {@link draw2d.layout.connection.CircuitConnectionRouter}.

This router allows users to manually adjust connection segments by dragging them, while also drawing:

  • Bridge (arc): at crossings where connections have NO shared ports
  • Vertex (dot): at crossings where connections share a source or target port

Perfect for interactive circuit/schematic diagram editors.

functions.name: init
functions.description: Creates a new Router object.

parameters.name: attr
parameters.description: optional attributes for the router

parameters.name: attr.bridgeRadius
parameters.description: the radius of the bridge arc in pixels

parameters.name: attr.vertexRadius
parameters.description: the radius of the vertex circle (default: connection stroke * 2)

parameters.name: setter
parameters.description: optional key/value map of injected setter-methods

parameters.name: getter
parameters.description: optional key/value map of injected getter-methods

functions.name: setVertexRadius
functions.description: Set the radius of the vertex circle (dot at shared port crossings). If not set, defaults to connection stroke * 2.

functions.name: getVertexRadius
functions.description: Get the vertex radius.

functions.name: _getVertexRadius
functions.description: Get the vertex radius for drawing. Returns the set value or calculates default from connection stroke.

functions.name: setBridgeRadius
functions.description: Set the radius of the bridge arc (arc at non-shared crossings).

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: the radius of the arc in pixels

functions.name: getBridgeRadius
functions.description: Get the bridge radius.

functions.name: _paintWithCircuitFeatures
functions.description: Override the paint method to draw bridges and vertex nodes at connection intersections

functions.name: route
functions.description: Routes the Connection.

parameters.name: connection
parameters.description: The Connection to route

parameters.name: routingHints
parameters.description: some helper attributes for the router

parameters.name: routingHints.startMoved
parameters.description: is true if just the start location has moved

parameters.name: routingHints.endMoved
parameters.description: is true if the destination location has changed

parameters.name: routingHints.oldVertices
parameters.description: the vertices before the reroute has been triggered

functions.name: halfRoute
functions.description: The routing algorithm if the user has changed at least on of the vertices manually. This kind of routing just align the start and end vertices to the new source/target port location. The vertices between keep untouched. Modification of this vertices are done by the draw2d.policy.line.OrthogonalSelectionFeedbackPolicy

parameters.name: conn
parameters.description: the connection to route

parameters.name: routingHints
parameters.description: some helper attributes for the router

parameters.name: routingHints.startMoved
parameters.description: is true if just the start location has moved

parameters.name: routingHints.endMoved
parameters.description: is true if the destination location has changed

functions.name: canRemoveSegmentAt
functions.description: Callback method for the PolyLine or Connection to verify that a segment is deletable.

functions.name: onDrag
functions.description: The draw2d.Connection delegates the drag operation to the router. The router can handle the different constraints of the connection and just drag&drop a single segment instead of the complete connection.

parameters.name: line
parameters.description: the related line to handle

parameters.name: dx
parameters.description: the x difference between the start of the drag drop operation and now

parameters.name: dy
parameters.description: the y difference between the start of the drag drop operation and now

parameters.name: dx2
parameters.description: The x diff since the last call of this dragging operation

parameters.name: dy2
parameters.description: The y diff since the last call of this dragging operation

functions.name: verticesSet
functions.description: Called by the connection if the vertices set outside. This enforce the router to avoid full autoroute. E.g. InteractiveManhattanRouter

functions.name: getPersistentAttributes
functions.description: Tweak or enrich the polyline persistence data with routing information

parameters.name: memento
parameters.description: The memento data of the polyline

functions.name: setPersistentAttributes
functions.description: set the attributes for the polyline with routing information of the interactive manhattan router.

functions.name: onInstall
functions.description: Callback method if the router has been assigned to a connection.

parameters.name: connection
parameters.description: The assigned connection

functions.name: _normalizeVertices
functions.description:
Normalize vertices to ensure perfect orthogonal lines. This corrects floating point errors from division operations. Only internal vertices are modified - start and end points remain unchanged to preserve port attachment.

Manhattan routes always alternate between horizontal and vertical segments. We determine the first segment direction from start point and align accordingly.

functions.name: _route
functions.description: Internal routing algorithm.

functions.name: attr
functions.description:
Read or set router attributes.
When no value is given, reads specified attribute from the element.
When value is given, sets the attribute to that value. Multiple attributes can be set by passing an object with name-value pairs.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: attribute name or object with name-value pairs

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: value to set (only if name is a string)

returns.description: either the requested attribute if this method used as getter or this if the method used as setter

functions.name: onUninstall
functions.description: Callback method if the router has been removed from the connection.

parameters.name: connection
parameters.description: The related connection

functions.name: canRemoveVertexAt
functions.description: Callback method for the PolyLine or Connection to check if it possible to remove a vertex from the list. The router can send an veto for this. Per default it is not possible to remove any vertex from the PolyLine exceptional if any interactive router is installed.

functions.name: clone
functions.description: Return a clone of the router object

constructor.name: InteractiveCircuitConnectionRouter

classes.name: InteractiveManhattanBridgedConnectionRouter
classes.description:
Combines the interactive segment manipulation of {@link draw2d.layout.connection.InteractiveManhattanConnectionRouter} with the bridge drawing capability of {@link draw2d.layout.connection.ManhattanBridgedConnectionRouter}.

This router allows users to manually adjust connection segments by dragging them, while also drawing bridges (arcs) where connections cross other connections.

functions.name: init
functions.description: Creates a new Router object.

parameters.name: attr
parameters.description: optional attributes for the router

parameters.name: attr.bridgeRadius
parameters.description: the radius of the bridge arc in pixels

parameters.name: setter
parameters.description: optional key/value map of injected setter-methods

parameters.name: getter
parameters.description: optional key/value map of injected getter-methods

functions.name: getBridgeRadius
functions.description: Get the bridge radius.

functions.name: setBridgeRadius
functions.description: Set the radius of the bridge arc.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: the radius of the arc in pixels

functions.name: _paintWithBridges
functions.description: Override the paint method to draw bridges at connection intersections

parameters.name: routingHints.endMoved
parameters.description: is true if the destination location has changed

parameters.name: routingHints.oldVertices
parameters.description: the vertices before the reroute has been triggered

This kind of routing just align the start and end vertices to the new source/target port location. The vertices between keep untouched. Modification of this vertices are done by the draw2d.policy.line.OrthogonalSelectionFeedbackPolicy

Manhattan routes always alternate between horizontal and vertical segments. We determine the first segment direction from start point and align accordingly.

classes.name: ManhattanBridgedConnectionRouter
classes.description:
Provides a {@link draw2d.Connection} with an orthogonal route between the Connection's source and target anchors. Draws a bridge (arc) where connections cross.

The connection with the HIGHER z-index draws the arc, ensuring the bridge is always rendered on top of the crossing line. Supports both horizontal and vertical bridges.

Use {@link draw2d.layout.connection.CircuitConnectionRouter} if you need vertex dots at crossings with shared ports (typical for circuit diagrams).

functions.name: init
functions.description: Creates a new Router object.

parameters.name: attr
parameters.description: optional attributes for the router

parameters.name: attr.bridgeRadius
parameters.description: the radius of the bridge arc in pixels

parameters.name: setter
parameters.description: optional key/value map of injected setter-methods

parameters.name: getter
parameters.description: optional key/value map of injected getter-methods

functions.name: onInstall
functions.description: Callback method if the router has been assigned to a connection.

parameters.name: connection
parameters.description: The assigned connection

functions.name: onUninstall
functions.description: Callback method if the router has been removed from the connection.

parameters.name: connection
parameters.description: The related connection

functions.name: setBridgeRadius
functions.description: Set the radius of the bridge arc.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: the radius of the arc in pixels

functions.name: getBridgeRadius
functions.description: Get the bridge radius.

functions.name: route
functions.description: Routes the Connection.

parameters.name: connection
parameters.description: The Connection to route

parameters.name: routingHints
parameters.description: some helper attributes for the router

parameters.name: routingHints.startMoved
parameters.description: is true if just the start location has moved

parameters.name: routingHints.endMoved
parameters.description: is true if the destination location has changed

parameters.name: routingHints.oldVertices
parameters.description: the vertices before the reroute has been triggered

functions.name: _normalizeVertices
functions.description:
Normalize vertices to ensure perfect orthogonal lines. This corrects floating point errors from division operations. Only internal vertices are modified - start and end points remain unchanged to preserve port attachment.

Manhattan routes always alternate between horizontal and vertical segments. We determine the first segment direction from start point and align accordingly.

functions.name: _route
functions.description: Internal routing algorithm.

functions.name: attr
functions.description:
Read or set router attributes.
When no value is given, reads specified attribute from the element.
When value is given, sets the attribute to that value. Multiple attributes can be set by passing an object with name-value pairs.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: attribute name or object with name-value pairs

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: value to set (only if name is a string)

returns.description: either the requested attribute if this method used as getter or this if the method used as setter

functions.name: canRemoveVertexAt
functions.description: Callback method for the PolyLine or Connection to check if it possible to remove a vertex from the list. The router can send an veto for this. Per default it is not possible to remove any vertex from the PolyLine exceptional if any interactive router is installed.

functions.name: canRemoveSegmentAt
functions.description: Callback method for the PolyLine or Connection to verify that a segment is deletable.

functions.name: getPersistentAttributes
functions.description: Tweak or enrich the polyline persistence data with routing information

parameters.name: memento
parameters.description: The memento data of the polyline

functions.name: setPersistentAttributes
functions.description: set the attributes for the polyline with routing information

parameters.name: memento
parameters.description: the JSON data to read

functions.name: onDrag
functions.description: The draw2d.Connection delegates the drag operation to the router. The router can handle the different constraints of the connection.

parameters.name: dx
parameters.description: the x difference between the start of the drag drop operation and now

parameters.name: dy
parameters.description: the y difference between the start of the drag drop operation and now

parameters.name: dx2
parameters.description: The x diff since the last call of this dragging operation

parameters.name: dy2
parameters.description: The y diff since the last call of this dragging operation

functions.name: verticesSet
functions.description: Called by the connection if the vertices set outside. This enforce the router to avoid full autoroute. E.g. InteractiveManhattanRouter

functions.name: clone
functions.description: Return a clone of the router object

classes.name: SketchConnectionRouter
classes.description: Provide a router which routes the connection in a hand drawn manner.

functions.name: init
functions.description: Creates a new Router object.

functions.name: onInstall
functions.description: Callback method if the router has been assigned to a connection.

parameters.name: connection
parameters.description: The assigned connection

functions.name: setPortOutletOffset
functions.description: Set the minimum distance from port before the first direction change. This creates a "outlet" segment that goes straight out from the port before the router makes any turns.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The distance in pixels (default: 30)

functions.name: getPortOutletOffset
functions.description: Get the current port outlet offset.

functions.name: _route
functions.description:
Internal routing algorithm. *

Possible values:

  • up -> 0
  • right -> 1
  • down -> 2
  • left -> 3

functions.name: generateNoGoGrid
functions.description: Generate a grid base no go map required for the path finding algorithm

functions.name: getAdjustedPoint
functions.description: move the point in the given direction with the given offset

functions.name: straightenPath
functions.description:
Straighten orthogonal segments in the path. This removes small "bumps" caused by grid-based routing.

If multiple consecutive points have nearly the same X or Y coordinate, they are aligned to the average value.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Array of points with x,y coordinates

parameters.name: tolerance
parameters.description: Maximum deviation to consider points as aligned

functions.name: removeCollinearPoints
functions.description: Remove collinear points from the path. Points that lie on a straight line between their neighbors are removed.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Array of points with x,y coordinates

constructor.name: SketchConnectionRouter
